definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: He is not being modest today.
Chen Yibing, the "lord of rings", has always kept a low profile and is modest.
sentences.chinese: “吊环王”陈一冰总是保持低调，并且很谦虚。

sentences.english: Humility is not modesty either, Tangney argues.
sentences.chinese: Tangney认为谦逊也不等同于谦虚。

sentences.english: The modest man moderately modified the model in this mode.
sentences.chinese: 谦虚者适度地用这种方法点窜了模型。

sentences.english: I wish she would learn to be more modest .
sentences.chinese: 我希望她能学着谦虚点。

sentences.english: Ceng Nianan modest recommended Han Jinquan do eldest brother, refuse Han Jinquan efforts.
sentences.chinese: 曾念安谦虚的推荐韩金铨做老大，韩金铨努力推辞。

sentences.english: Nobody can say I put on airs. I'm actually very humble.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不能说我这人摆架子，事实上我是很谦虚的人。

sentences.english: There is a fine line between humility and timidity too.
sentences.chinese: 同时谦虚和怯懦这两者之间的区别也是很明显的。

sentences.english: We have made some achievements, still we should be modest and prudent.
sentences.chinese: 我们取得了一些成绩，但我们仍须谦虚谨慎。

sentences.english: True, I'm not modest at all.
Scantiness of modesty is short of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 缺少谦虚就是没有知识。

sentences.english: But Cai Wei is still very modest.
sentences.chinese: 但是蔡伟仍然十分谦虚。

sentences.english: Good behavior flows naturally from that kind of humility.
sentences.chinese: 对于谦虚的人来说，良好的行为发乎自然。

definition: to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
